summary: WE BOUGHT A HORSE TRAILER WITH NEW TIRES ON IT IN 2008.  THESE TIRES HAVE ABOUT 4000 MILES ON THEM.  IN MAY I HAD A BLOW OUT AND THEN ANOTHER ONE IN JULY.  THE TRAILER HAS ONLY BEEN OUT 4 TIMES THIS YEAR.  I JUST  THOUGHT THE FIRST BLOW OUT WAS ONE OF THOSE THINGS, HOWEVER WHEN THE SECOND ONE OCCURRED I DECIDED TO GO ON LINE AND CHECK OUT MY TIRES.  THEY ARE YKS TELLURIDE   LT235/85R16  LOAD RANGE E  CR 860 WITH A DOT # 7DT2FTS   I DO NOT DARE TAKE THE TRAILER OUT AGAIN.  IT HAS COST ME TOWING SERVICES.  AND I WILL HAVE TO REPLACE A FENDER AND LIGHT.  I HAVE HAD TO RENT ANOTHER TRAILER TO TRANSPORT HORSES.  SINCE THERE IS A RECALL ON THESE TIRES, I AM HOPING THAT THESE COSTS CAN BE COVERED.   I NEED TO GET IT FIXED SOON SO THAT I CAN GO BACK TO USING IT. *TR

MY 1999 NISSAN PATHFINDER HAD 1 PRIOR OWNER PURCHASED FROM NISSAN AUTO MALL  IN LI NY THE BACK CAR WAS IN BEAUTIFUL CONDITION BACKSEATS  LOOKED AS IF THEY HAD NEVER BEEN USED DEALER INFORMED ME VEHICLE HAD BEEN OWNED & CUSTOMIZED FOR THE 1 PRIOR OWNER WHO HAD A HANDICAP AS DID HIS CHILD WHO HAD TO BE SEATED IN THE FRONT DUE TO HIS MEDICAL ISSUES/HANDICAP ISSUES  THIS WAS WHY THE VEHICLE WAS IN SUCH BEAUTIFUL CONDITION SINCE I WAS TOTALLY DISABLED 1994  IN AN ACCIDENT HEAD ON TO THE EXTENT THE FRAME WAS BENT  BADLY YET THE AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY I WAS VERY CONCERNED YET  WAS TOLD AIR BAGS WERE IN THE VEHICLE & APPEARED TO BE NOT A PROBLEM ORTHE LIGHT WOULD NOT GO ON UPON STARTING VEHICLE I ALSO MADE SEVERAL INQUIRES TO NISSAN DEALER CONSUMER AFFAIRS ETC... ETC... & MY INSURER & WAS TOLD NO LIKE ISSUES &/OR RECALLS OR SAFETY ISSUES & MY FEARS WERE NOT WARRANTED WELL ON 2 OTHER FRONT END CRASHES I BELIEVE DUE TO OTHER SAFETY ISSUES ACCELERATION STEERING LOSS & BREAKING ISSUES AGAIN WITH MAJOR DAMAGE TO FRONT END RADIATOR DESTROYED CHASSY BENT /CRACKED THE VEHICLE AIRBAGS FAILED TO DEPLOY NOR DID THE SEAT BELTS LOCK AGAIN I IN 1998 DID AGAIN MAKE NUMEROUS INQUIRIES & FOUND AIRBAG SYSTEMS HAD PLACED DEFECTIVE SWITCHES IN VEHICLES BUT FAILED TO HAVE A TRACKING SYSTEM TO ID THE VEHICLES &/OR MANUFACTURERS WHOM HAD PLACED THESE SWITCHES THAT MADE IT APPEAR AS THE AIR BAGS WERE INDEED FUNCTIONING WHEN THEY WERE TURNED OFF & THAT NHTSA STATED IT WAS NOT THERE JOB TO GIVE HIM DOCUMENTS SHOWING VEHICLES WITH THESE FAULTY SWITCHES WHICH WAS AN ENDANGERMENT TO OWNERS&/REPAIR FACILITIES WHO WOULD BE UNAWARE THE AIRBAGS WERE TURNED OFF AS THE LIGHT SHOWING PROPER ABS FUNCTION I CANT BELIEVE THE GROSS DISREGARD I ALSO UNDERSTAND THAT THESE MODIFICATIONS DID NOT HAVE TO BE REPORTED UNLESS DONE SO VOLUNTARILY TO DMV/OR NHTSA UNTIL SOMETIME IN 2002/3/4 SO PUTTING YOUR VIN # IN WOULD NOT SHOW A CONSUMER THEIR AIRBAGS WERE IN FACT DEACTIVATED EVEN IF VOLUNTARY DOCUMENTS WERE SUBMIT. *TR

I HAVE A 1999 CHEVROLET CAVALIER WITH ABS. I HAD APPROXIMATELY 85,000 MILES ON MY CAR. IN SEPTEMBER 2007, MY ABS WARNING LIGHT AND BRAKE WARNING LIGHT CAME ON IN THE DASHBOARD. I TOOK MY CAR TO THE DEALER AND TO MY MECHANIC -- BOTH TOLD ME THAT ONE OR MORE OF THE ABS SENSORS HAD FAILED AND THAT IT WOULD COST APPROXIMATELY $900 TO $1000 TO REPLACE THE ABS SYSTEM. BOTH ALSO TOLD ME THAT THERE WAS NO DANGER OF BRAKE FAILURE, BUT THAT THE ANTI-SKID FEATURE WAS NOW DISABLED. THEY ALSO SAID THAT HAVING MY BRAKES CHECKED AND REPLACED IF NECESSARY MAY SOLVE THIS PROBLEM. I HAVE HAD NEW BRAKE PADS AND ROTORS INSTALLED, BUT THIS HAS NOT HAD ANY AFFECT ON THE ABS SENSING. HAS THERE BEEN A RECALL ON THIS PRODUCT?  *TR
I WAS INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT WHEN THE POWER STEERING WENT OUT ON THE 1999 CHEVROLET CAVALIER.*AK

1999 BMW 328I REAR SUSPENSION FAILURE.  DURING NORMAL DRIVING I HIT A POTHOLE,  AND THEN NOTICED VIBRATION FROM THE REAR OF THE CAR WHILE UNDER ACCELERATION.  I TOOK THE CAR TO A SHOP, AND THEY INFORMED ME THE LEFT REAR SUSPENSION MOUNT FAILED.  AND THE RIGHT REAR MOUNT CRACKED AND  WAS READY TO FAIL.  THE CONSEQUENCES, AFTER REVIEWING THIS  PROBLEM  ON THE WEB AND BMW CAR CLUB, FOUND THAT THIS FAILURE WAS COMMON ON THIS CAR DUE TO MANUFACTURING DESIGN FLAW , AND THE REPAIR COST WILL BE $2000 TO $3000!  THE CAR WAS NOT SAFE TO DRIVE.  THE CAR IS AT A BODY SHOP AWAITING APPROVAL FOR REPAIR.  THE CAR WAS OTHERWISE PERFECT OR NEAR PERFECT FOR A CAR WITH 106,000 MILES.   *AK

I WAS PURCHASING A VEHICLE AND THE CAR LOT SAID THAT IT HAD A SMOKING PROBLEM DUE TO BAD VALVE COVER GASKETS.  WILL THE GASKETS WHERE CHANGED AND I STILL HAD A SMOKING PROBLEM.  EVENTUALLY, THE CAR CAUGHT ON FIRE DUE TO MECHANICAL MALFUNCTION.  I HAVE ALL THE REPORTS FROM BBB, ATTORNEYS GENERAL, AND THE FIRE MARSHALL REPORT.  *NM
ENGINE PROBLEMS.  *NM
WHEN TURN FORWARD OR BACKWARD VEHICLE STARTS TO SHAKE AS IF IT HAS A MISS IN IT

5 TRANSMISSION CHANGES, GOING ON 6TH. OVER THE LAST 6 YEARS WITH FAULTY TRANSMISSION, EXPERIENCED, NEAR DEATH ACCIDENTS, EXCESSIVE JERKING, SLIPPING, TIRE PEELING ETC. THE TRANSMISSIONS WERE REPLACED UNDER FACTORY WARRANT, EXTENDED WARRANTY, AND THE TRANSMISSION WARRANTY AFTER THE EXTENDED EXPIRED. A REFURBISHED/ FAULTY TRANSMISSION WAS INSTALLED AFTER EVERY FAILURE. RANGE OF LIFE OF TRANSMISSION LASTED BETWEEN 10,000 MILES TO 40,000 MILES. CURRENTLY, WARRANTY WAS OVER, AND EXPERIENCED   ANOTHER TRANSMISSION FAILURE. UNLESS ACURA  CORRECTS SITUATION WILL USE LEGAL FORCE.*AK

I CURRENTLY OWN A 1999 BMW Z3 AND THE WARNING LIGHTS FOR THE CAR ARE A PROBLEM.  THE AIRBAG WARNING LIGHT HAS COME ON 3 DIFFERENT TIMES AND THE DEALER HAS NOT BEEN ABLE TO FIX THE PROBLEM.  I AM CONCERNED FOR MY SAFTY AND THE SAFETY OF MY PASSENGERS.  I AM TOLD THE SYSTEM WILL WORK CORRECTLY BUT WOULD LIKE BMW TO RECALL THE CAR AND FIX THE PROBLEM FOR GOOD.*AK

I PURCHASED A UTILITY TRAILER MADE BY JA-MAR MANUFACTURING. CO. PULLING IT EMPTY LAT MONTH THE TRAILER SOMEHOW CAME OFF OF THE RECEIVER WHILE I WAS TRAVELING ON THE INTERSTATE. IN THE EVENT OF THAT HAPPENING THE SAFETY CHAINS ARE SUPPOSED TO KEEP IT ATTACHED TO THE VEHICLE UNTIL YOU CAN MAKE A SAFE STOP, BUT IN MY CASE THE CHAINS SNAPPED OFF AND THE TRAILER FREE WHEELED DOWN THE HIGHWAY.  *AK

DESIGN DEFECT IN TRAILER.   *MR   THE PROBLEM WAS CAUSED BY ELECTROLYSIS BECAUSE THE COMPANY USED A PIECE OF 3M SCRATCH TO PREVENT FROM CORROSION BETWEEN THE ALUMINUM AND STEEL SIDE COILS.  THIS PROBLEM CAUSED EXTENSIVE DAMAGES WHEN THE VEHICLE WAS MAKING A RIGHT HAND TURN WHEN THE TRAILER WENT THROUGH A DIP IN THE ROAD.  THE TRAILER TWISTED THROUGH THE DIP OF THE 5TH WHEEL PIN CARRIER RAILS THAT GAVE WAY FROM IT'S MOUNTS ON THE SIDE RAILS OF THE TRAILER, COLLAPSING AND PULLING THE FRONT TRAILER OUT.  (1999 CORNHUSKER GRAIN TRAILER)   *SC

THE SEALS ON THE PASSENGER SIDE AND REAR WINDOWS  WERE DETERIORATING.  THE SEALS WERE MOVING ON THE INSIDE OF THE DOUBLE SIDED GLASS.  THE SEALS CAUSED VISIBILITY PROBLEMS FOR THE CONSUMER.   *AK  (MOUNTAIN RESIDENCY)   *SC  *JB

PROBLEMS WITH EMERGENCY BRAKES, DOOR LATCH, PROPANE LEAK, AND GAS REGULATOR.   *MR   THERE WAS AN ELECTRICAL SHORT, EMERGENCY BRAKE SWITCH WAS INSTALLED BACKWARDS, THE DOOR LATCH WHICH WAS IN THE OPEN POSITION WAS INSTALLED TOO HIGH AND DIDN'T WORK PROPERLY.  THERE WAS A PROPANE LEAK  BECAUSE THE HOSE WAS INSTALLED CORRECTLY AND THE GAS REGULATOR WAS ON RECALL.  (1999 KOMFORT 5TH WHEEL)   *SCC  JB

CARLISLE ST215/75P14, ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT ON TRAILMASTER BOAT TRAILER, 4 YEARS OLD.  APPROXIMATELY 2,500 MILES ON TIRES.  LITTLE TREAD WEAR.  60MPH ON HIGHWAY, PASSENGER SIDE TIRE (SINGLE AXLE TRAILER) BLEW.  DRIVER FELT HARD JOLT, PASSENGER LOOKING IN SIDE MIRROR SAW TREAD BLOW OFF.  TIRE SPLIT FROM INNER RIM BEAD TO OUTER RIM BEAD ACROSS CROWN OF TIRE, IN TWO PLACES, ALMOST ON EXACT OPPOSITE SIDES OF RIM.   ENTIRE TREAD LAYER FLEW OFF FROM RIP TO RIP.  STEEL BELTS CURLED BACK AT SPLIT.  BLOWOUT OCCURRED JULY 5, 2003.DAMAGE WAS LIMITED TO TIRE AND RIM.*AK

TIRE TREAD SEPARATED; CARLISLE ST205/75R14 PURCHASED NEW WITH EAGLE BRAND BOAT TRAILER (VIN [XXX], MODEL B20-50TB) MANUFACTURED DECEMBER 1998 BY JOHNSTON ACQUISITION CORP., 13TH STREET, WYANDOTTE, MI.  THIS IS THE SECOND TIRE TO FAIL IN THIS WAY.  THE FIRST ONE FAILED APPROX. JULY 4, 2002.   *NLM    INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).  *TR

WHILE TRAVELING ABOUT 65MPH ON THE HIGHWAY AND WITHOUT PRIOR WARNING RIGHT REAR TIRE TREAD SEPARATED FROM WHEEL.CONSUMER  WAS ABLE TO PULL OVER TO THE SHOULDER. FIRESTONE WILDERNESS LT, P225/75R16, DOTVE1L1XD E RATE.   *AK COACHMEN E450 1999*TS

TIRES LOOSE THE CAP AT BETWEEN 3-6K MILES.  I HAVE HAD A COUPLE OF THEM LOOSE THE CAP AND STILL HOLD AIR FOR ABOUT 2-3 MILES TRYING TO FIND A PLACE I COULD PULL OFF OF THE HIGHWAY AND CHANGE TIRE. I WENT THROUGH 7 TIRES ON MY 24' COVERED TRAILER AND HAVE GONE THROUGH 3 ON MY CAR HAULER.  I WENT TO A FIRESTONE TIRE AND SOLVED THE PROBLEM ON THE COVERED TRAILER.  STILL HAVE A SET ON OF THE HIGH FAILURE RATE TIRES ON MY CAR HAULER. GETTING READY TO REPLACE THOSE ON THE CAR HAULER WITH THE SAME FIRESTONE TIRES.  OVER 12 K ON THE FIRESTONE AND NOT A SINGLE PROBLEM.   *NLM
THE LEFT REAR INSIDE TIRE EXPERIENCED TREAD SEPARATION.  *JB  REMAINING TIRE DEPTH IS 11/32,"  AND THE WEIGHT IS WELL WITHIN SPECIFICATIONS.  (DODGEN CLASSIC 26' 1999)  SCC

HAD 1ST BLOW OUT IN JANUARY 2002 NO DAMAGE TO MOTOR HOME . TOOK TIRE TO FIRESTON DEALER AND HE REPLACED IT FOR FREE.2ND BLOWOUT HAPPINED 8-24-02 CAUSED ABOUT $1500.00 DAMAGE TO MY MOTORHOME. WENT OUT TODAY AND REPLACED ALL 7 TIRES WITH GOODYEAR TIRES.*AK

summary: AMONG THE FAILURES OF THESE VEHICLES HAVE BEEN WINDSHIELDS WHCIH FALL OUT, EXHAUST SYSTEMS WHICH DISINTEGRATE AND OFR WHICH REPLACEMENT PARTS ARE UNAVAILABLE, ELECTRICAL SYSTEM MALFUNCTIONS, AIR BAG AND SUSPENSION FAILURES,LOOSE MOTOR MOUNTS AND AN ASTONISHING VOLUME OF LESSER PROBLEMS.
THE CAMPER HAD MAJOR ROOF AND BODY REPAIRS (POORLY DONE) AND I WAS NOT TOLD OF THIS. I BOUGHT THE CAMPER AS A NEW ITEM NOT A BLEMISHED OR FACTORY 2ND.*AK

WE BELIEVE OUR '99 FLAGSTAFF 26DS RV HAD INADEQUATE AXELS FOR THE WEIGHT OF THE CAMPER.  OUR RV WEIGHS 4700 LBS EMPTY.  IT HAD TWO 2200 LB. RATED AXELS.  WE HAD A BLOW OUT AND HAD TO REPLACE 4 OTHER TIRES DUE TO EXCESSIVE WEAR.  THEN WE DISCOVERED THE WEAR WAS DUE TO A BENT AXEL.  OUR RV DEALER, SUNWAY RV, HAD GONE OUT OF BUSINESS SO WE CONTACTED FOREST RIVER, DUNLOP TIRE AND ALKO KOBLER CORP, THE AXEL SUPPLIER.  DUNLOP DID REMIMBURSE US $500 ON A $631.32 CLAIM FOR THE TIRE WARRENTEE.  ALKO KOBLER CORP SAID THERE WAS NO FLAW IN THE METAL OF THE AXEL WE RETURNED, THEREFORE THEIR 5 YEAR WARRENTEE DID NOT COVER BENDING.   HOWEVER, THEY DID FEEL THE AXELS WERE TOO LIGHT FOR THE WEIGHT.  FOREST RIVER GAVE US NO SATISFACTION ON OUR REQUEST FOR NEW HEAVIER AXELS AND FOR DAMAGES.  WE DID HOWEVER, PURCHASE TWO NEW 3000 LB. RATED AXELS FROM FOREST RIVER AND HAD THEM INSTALLED BY SOUTH EAST TRAILER SALES OF KEY LARGO, FL.  THEY ALSO FELT THE ORIGINAL AXELS WERE INADEQUATE.  AFTER REPLACING OUR AXELS WE DISCOVERED FOREST RIVER UPGRADED THE AXELS TO 3000 LB. ON THE NEXT YEAR'S MODEL OF THE FLAGSTAFF RV EVEN THOUGH THEY INCREASED THE WEIGHT BY ONLY 300 LBS..  WE FEEL FOREST RIVER SHOULD HAVE A RECALL ON OUR MODEL RV AND SHOULD COMPENSATE US FOR THE COST OF THE AXELS, REPLACEMENT COSTS AND RELATED DAMAGES.*AK

DANGEROUS TREAD SEPARATION WHILE HIGHWAY TRAVELING.  THIS HAS OCCURRED ON FOUR DIFFERENT OCCASIONS, RESULTING IN DAMAGE TO TRAVEL TRAILER INCLUDING THE CUTTING OF ELECTRIC BRAKE WIRING AN DAMAGE TO UNDERCARRIAGE.  THIS SAME TYPE OF TIRE FAILURE OCCURED, 04/06/01, 03/02/01, 12/13/00.    A  VOQ  REPORT WAS MADE ON 09/04/01 TO NHTSA.*AK

RECIEVED NOTICE THAT GOODYEAR WAS RECALLING LT245/75R16 TIRES ON 15 PASSENGER FORD VANS 2000 MODELS.  WE HAVE THE SAME TIRES ON OUR RV AND THEY HAVE NOT BEEN RE-CALLED.  I HAVE SPOKE WITH GOODYEAR AND THEY SAID THEY WERE NOT CONCERNED WITH ANYTHING OTHER THAN 15 PASSENGER VANS.  I FEEL THAT IF THE TIRE IS DANGEROUS  AND COULD CAUSE A ROLL-OVER ON A VAN THEN IT COULD POSSIBLE CAUSE THE SAME PROBLEM ON OUR RV THAT HAS THE SAME GOODYEAR TIRE.  PLEASE, REPLY TO THIS COMMENT AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.  THANK YOU, CLOYCE SCARBERRY. *AK (TIRESIZE: LT245/75R1)

THE OUTRIGGERS PORTION OF THE FRAME ARE BENDING CAUSING THE EXTERIOR WALS TO SAG. I WENT INTO A DEALERSHIP TODAY & SAW TWO TRAILERS OF SAME MAKE AND YEAR WITH THE SAME PROBLEM, ONE OF THEM FAILED COMPLETELY CAUSING THE WALL TO FALL FROM THE FRAME AND DRAG ON THE ROADWAY.*AK

THE LARGER FLEETWOOD/COLEMAN POPUP CAMPERS HAVE A HISTORY OF SWAY RELATED PROBLEMS. OUR PARTICULAR PROBLEM OCCURRED WHEN WERE TOWING THE VEHICLE BACK HOME. THE CAMPER WAS UNLOADED AND AT 65 MPH THE TRAILER STARTED SWAYING BADLY. WE EASED DOWN ON THE SPEED AND THE SWAYING CEASED. WE COULD NOT TRAVEL FASTER THAN 65 MPH WITHOUT THE TRAILER SWAYING BADLY. THIS IS NOT AN ISOLATED PROBLEM. I KNOW OF AT LEAST 2 ACCIDENTS WITH THESE TRAILERS, ONE ACCIDENT HAVING INJURIES. FOR FURTHER INFORMATION YOU MAY CALL PECO CAMPERS SERVICE DEPARTMENT AT 404-377-8000 AND TALK TO THERE MECHS OR SERVICE MANAGER. ALSO IF YOU WILL GO TO THE POPUP TIMES MESSAGE FORUM AT HTTP://216.122.245.233/FORUM/DEFAULT.ASP AND SEARCH FOR SWAYING OR SWAY YOU WILL FIND NUMEROUS THREADS ON THIS DEFECT. NO OTHER POPUP MANUFACTURER IS HAVING THIS PROBLEM, AND IT APPEARS TO ONLY OCCUR IN THE LARGER POPUP CAMPER MODELS WITH FRONT STORAGE. THIS IS SERIOUS PROBLEM AND I KNOW THAT INJURIES HAVE BEEN REPORTED IN AT LEAST ONE ACCIDENT.

HARSH RIDE CAUSING DASH/FIREWALL/SIDEWALLS TO BREAK OR SEPARATE, BROKEN STRUCTURAL WELDS CONNECTING THE BODY AND CHASSIS, AND LOOSE STEERING WHEEL MAKES VEHICLE HARD TO CONTROL WHEN RIDING OVER RAIL ROAD TRACKS OR OTHER PAVEMENT DEFECTS

MY NAME IS [XXX] AND ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS I HAVE CONTACTED SEVERAL PEOPLE TO HELP FIX THIS PROBLEM, BUT NO ONE HAS HELPED ME SO FAR. SO THIS IS THE STORY OF WHAT HAPPENED.  ON OR ABOUT THE 18TH OF MAY MY MOTORHOME THAT I WAS DRIVING TO TENNESSE TO DO SOME SIGHT SEEING THE REAR SPRINGS GAVE AWAY WHILE GOING DOWN THE INTERSTATE SO I CALLED ROADSIDE SERVICE THEY CAME AND TOWED ME TO THE FORD PLACE BY THE NAME OF [XXX] FORD OF KNOXVILLE TN.  [XXX] WOULD NOT DO ANYTHING TO IT BECAUSE IT WAS OVERWEIGHT ON THE REAR AXLES. SO I THEN CONTACTED NEWMAR CORP. AND THEY UPGRADED THE REAR SPRINGS FROM 11,000GVWR TO 2,000 WHICH MADE IT 13,000GVWR ON A 11,000 LB. AXLE THEY WANT TO PUT A13,500 REAR AXLE ON IT WITH THE CHASIS THAT HAS BEEN CUT INTO IN THE MIDDLE WITH 38 INCHES ADDED IN THE MIDDLE WITH DRY WEIGHT 11,100 LB. ON REAR AXLE IS ALL OF THIS SAFE ? TRIED TO CONTACT FORD REPRESENTIVES SEVERAL TIMES NO RESPONSE . TRIED TO CONTACT MR. [XXX] OR [XXX] WOULD NOT TALK TO ME ? MR[XXX] WITH FORDMOTOR HOME CHASIS REP. SAID THE QUESTIONS I WAS ASKING WAS ABOVE HIS HEAD AND DID NOT KNOW WHO I NEEDED TO TALK TO ? THANK FOR YOUR TIME ON THIS MATTER I AM AT WITS END SIGNED  [XXX]. *AK    PARTS OF THIS DOCUMENT HAVE BEEN REDACTED TO PROTECT PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).

CONVERSION VAN CANNOT BE DRIVEN OVER %% MPH  WITHOUT SEVERE ROAD WANDER   A TSB WAS ISSUED AND COMPLETED BUT DID NOT FIX THE PROBLEM CAN NOT KEEP VAN IN LANE VERY SCARY TO DRIVE HAD TWO FRONT END MECHANICS SAY THEY WOULD NOT DRIVE IT OVER50 MPH. *AK

DUE TO POOR QUALITY WELDING ON KING PIN, THE PIN BROKE LOOSE CAUSING A NEAR ACCIDENT DUE TO NEAR DISENGAGEMENT OF PIN FROM THE TOW HITCH. INSPECTION BY CERTIFIED WELDER CONFIRMED THAT THERE WAS POOR WELD PENETRATION. MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED BY LETTER ALONG WITH PHOTOS AND THEY HAVE REFUSED TO ACKNOWLEDGE. I REQUESTED THAT OTHER TRAILERS BUILT DURING THE SAME TIME FRAME BE INSPECTED TO DETERMINE IF THIS WAS AN ISOLATED FAILURE OR IF THERE IS A POTENTIAL OF OTHER FAILURES. THEY HAVE REFUSED TO DO SO.*AK

YOU MIGHT NOT BE THE RIGHT AGENCY, BUT I WANTED TO COMPLAIN ABOUT THE HIGH INTENSITY LIGHTS ON MANY CARS.   I GET REALLY BLINDED BY THEM FAIRLY OFTEN THESE DAYS WHEN I AM ON THE HIGHWAY.   I CANNOT BELIEVE THAT THESE LIGHTS ARE LEGAL.   PLEASE LET ME KNOW WHAT IS BEING DONE ABOUT THIS PUBLIC HAZARD.  *AK
VAN SWAYS AND FOLLOWS RUTS IN ROAD IS HARD TO CONTROL AT HIGHER SPEEDS. *AK

THIS VEHICLE HAS HAD NUMEROUS COMPONENTS BRAKE/, WINDSHIELD HAS POPPED OUT ON IT'S OWN WHILE STATIONARY, THE PROPANE SYSTEM IS CONSTAINTLY MALFUNCTIONING AND THE LIST GOES ON AND ON. I HAVE AROUND 200 DOCUMENTED FAILURES AND OR PROBLEMS.  THEY EVEN HAD TO TORCH OFF THE REAR AXLE TO MOVE IT INTO PROPER ALIGNMENT AFTER 8 MONTHS OF FIGHTING THEM.  THE VEHICLE IS A HAZARD TO THE HIGHWAY AND IT'S OCCUPANTS.  THE BATTERY TRAYS ARE RIPPING APART LIKE ONE WOULD TEAR PAPER DUE TO INADAQUATE METAL THICKNESS AND STRENGTH.  THE HYDRAULIC SYSTEM COMPLETELY BROKE AND WAS HANGING BY THE HOSES.  BOTH THE BATTERY BOX AND THE HYDRAULIC UNIT WERE FROM METAL FATIGUE AND DID NOT BREAK AT THE WELDS.  THE MANUFACTURER AGREED TO REPLACE THE VEHICLE OVER 4 MONTHS AGO AND THEY ARE DRAGGING IT OUT TO FRUSTRATE ME. I HAVE A FEAR THAT THERE ARE MANY OF THESE MOTORHOMES BUILT BY NATIONAL RV IN PARRIS, CALIFORNIA THAT ARE A HAZARD TO THE OCCUPANTS AND OTHER MOTORISTS ON THE ROAD.

THE VEHICLE BEGAN TO MAKE A LIGHT HOWLING NOISE, AND THEN THE INTERIOR PANEL&STEREO SHUT OFF FOR A MOMENT,THE ENGINE THEN STUMBLED, AND A STRONG BURNING SMELL AROSE.  I STOPPED THE VEHICLE, OPENED THE HOOD, AND FOUND THE ALTERNATOR ON FIRE, BAILING THICK BLACK SMOKE.
FIRE DEPARTMENT BELIEVES THAT IT WAS A FAULTY CABLE FROM THE ALTERNATOR.. *AK

THE TRANSMISSION PROBLEM SHOULD BE CORRECTED BY THE MANUFACTURER-DEALER REPLACING THE ENTIRE TRANSMISSION WITH A NEW 2001 UNIT.  THE THROTTLE I REPLACED OUT OF MY OWN POCKET.  THE THROTTLE FAILURE WAS MORE DANGEROUS OF THE TWO FAILURES AS IT OCCURED AT FREEWAY SPEEDS IN THICK FAST TRAFFIC.  THESE BIKES HAVE HAD ABOUT  A DOZEN OTHER NHTSA RECALLS              KET.  THE THROTLLE  CABLE BREAKING WAS THE MORE DANGEROUS. *AK
WHILE DRIVING ON HWY 87 (ARIZONA) AT A SPEED OF 65MPH I EXPERIENCED A BLOW OUT WITH SOME TREAD SEPARATION ON THE RIGHT REAR OUTER TIRE.  *AK (DOT NUMBER: VD1L 1XD  TIRESIZE: 75R16 M/S)

MY PROBLEMS BEGAN AROUND THE 8000 MILE MARK.  I HAD PROBLEMS WITH MY AIRBAG LIGHT STAYING ON, AND MY DASH LIGHTS AND SUCH NOT WORKING.  I BROUGHT MY CAR TO GILES (THE ONLY PEOPLE WHO CAN WORK ON A DAEWOO IN THE SURROUNDING AREAS) AND THEY CHANGED SENSORS, DASH PANELS AND SUCH.  NOW THE PROBLEM HAS ESCALATED TO FUSE BURNING.  I CAN'T START MY CAR WITHOUT BURNING A FUSE OR TWO.  THE PROBLEM WITH MY WHEEL STARTED AROUND THE SAME TIME AND IN THE SAME WAY; SMALL AT FIRST, THEN IT ESCALATED.  IT BEGAN WITH A SQUEAK AND A COUPLE OF BRAKE JOBS.  THEN IT STARTED MAKING THIS HORRIBLY LOUD HUMMING NOISE THAT GILES TOLD ME WAS MY TIRES.  I CHANGED ALL FOUR OF MY TIRES IN FEBRUARY AND THE PROBLEM PERSISTED AND GOT WORSE.  JUST THIS PAST WEEK I BROUGHT MY CAR BACK TO THE DEALERSHIP FOR GRINDING BRAKES AND AFTER ALL THE OTHER TIMES OF MY QUESTIONING THIS NOISE, THEY FINALLY DECIDED THAT I WAS MISSING BEARINGS AND THE HUB WAS BAD.  MY FAMILIES LIFE AND MINE WERE AT JEOPARDY.*AK
FOUND THAT THE TRANSMISSION C-CLIP FAILED AND GEARS INSIDE THE TRANSMISSION LOCKED. *AK
I HAVE HEARD REPORTS OF TRANSMISSION FAILURES ON THIS VEHICLE. I AM CONCERNED THAT THIS MAY OCCUR TO ME AS WELL IN THE FUTURE.

THERE IS A PROBLEM WITH THE TRANSMISSION LOCKING UP WHILE RIDING THE MOTORCYCLE.  ALTHOUGH I HAVE NOT HAD THIS PROBLEM, TWO OTHER PEOPLE OWNING THIS MOTORCYCLE HAVE HAD THEIR TRANSMISSION LOCK UP.  ONE PERSON WAS INJURED.  THIS IS A POTENTIAL PROBLEM FOR MANY MORE OWNERS OF THIS MOTORCYCLE.  THE EXCELSIOR-HENDERSON MOTORCYCLE CO., CURRENTLY OWNED BY EH PARTNERS, HAS REFUSED TO ADDRESS THIS ISSUE.  THIS IS THE REASON I AM WRITTING THIS COMPLAINT.*AK

THE TRANSMISSION ON MY MOTORCYCLE LOST A CIRCLIP, ALLOWING A GEAR TO FLOAT OVER THE LOCK THE BIKE UP AT ABOUT 40 MPH.  THIS HAS ALSO HAPPENED TO OTHER RIDERS, AND NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED.  THE COMPANY HASN'T ADDRESSED THIS, AND ISN'T PLANNING ON IT EITHER.  PLEASE HELP.*AK
CLUTCH WAS FOUND DISCONNECTED, REPAIR ACCOMPLISHED.  *AK
WHEN DOWNSHIFTING FROM 3RD INTO 2ND GEAR, TRANSMISSION SKIPS 2ND AND DROPS DIRECTLY INTO NEUTRAL.*AK

DUE TO A FAULTY STARTER RELAY COMPONENT, WHEN I ATTEMTED TO START MY BIKE BECAUSE OF LOW BATTERY VOLTAGE IT NOT ONLY WOULDN'T START , BUT IT WOULDN'T STOP TRYING TO START WHEN IGNITION SWITCH WAS TURNED OFF. THIS RESULTED IN THE BATTERY GETTING EXTREMELY HOT AND HAD I NOT MANAGED TO GET THE COVER OFF AND BATTERY DISCONNECTED WOULD HAVE BURNT THE BIKE UP! AS IT WAS , I NEEDED TO REPLACE THE BATTERY, STARTER RELAY, AND THE STARTER. THE BATTERY WAS EGG SHAPED AND BURNT MY HANDS BY THE TIME I GOT IT PULLED OUT OF THE BIKE.  *AK

SEPERATION OF VALVE STEM (METALIC VULCANIZED ) INSERT IN RUBBER GROMMET SUPPORT IN WHEELS. THE WHOLE INSERT BLEW OUT OF THE GROMMET WHILE TRAILER WAS SITTING IN PARKED SITE. WHEN THE SPARE TIRE WAS INSTALLED THE SAME THING A SECOND TIME AS THE TRAILER WAS LOWER WHILE ON THE JACK. THE METALIC INSERT HIT MY SON IN THE CHEST AS IT BULLETED OUT OF THE WHEEL. HE WAS NOT INJURED ALTHOUGH HE COULD HAVE BEEN. THE PROBLEM IS IF THESE VALVE STEMS FAIL DURING TRANSIT AT HIGHWAY SPEEDS THE COULD BE FATAL ACCIDENTS , ESPECIALLY IF TWO FAILURES OCCUR ON THE SAME SIDE.FURTHER MY COMPLAINT IS THE DEALER AND THE MANUFACTURER FLEETWOOD WILL NOT REPLACE/REPAIR THE FIVE WHEELS/STEMS ON MY UNIT AND I WILL NOT PULL THIS UNIT ON THE ROAD IN IT'S PRESENT CONDITION DUE TO THE SAFETY ISSUE. IT IS OBVIOUS THAT THE FAILURE IS CAUSED BY A MANUFACTURING DEFECT IN THE VALVE STEM THAT WAS INSTALLED BY FLEETWOOD IN THE MANUFACTURING PROCESS OF THIS UNIT. I HAVE BEEN TOLD BY A DEALER REPRESENTATIVE THAT FLEETWOOD BUY'S TIRES FROM MANY DEALERS AND INSTALLS THE TIRES ON WHEELS AT THEIR FACTORIES. THIS IS A SAFETY ISSUE THAT CAN/COULD CAUSE INJURY AND/OR DEATH . I TOOK THE TIRE AND WHEEL TO A LOCAL GOODYEAR DEAL;ER IN MY AREA AND SHOWED THEM WHAT HAD HAPPENED. THEIR RESPONSE WAS THAT THE STEM INSTALLED IN MY WHEELS WERE FOR NORMAL AUTOMOBILE TIRES AND WERE NOT HIGH PRESSURE (80 PSI & UP) AS ARE THE TIRES ON MY TRAILER, THIS PROBABLY EXPLAINS THE FAILURE AND ALL OF THE VALVE STEMS (5) ON MY UNIT APPEAR TOO BE THE SAME! IF FLEETWOOD CONTINUES TO INSTALL THE INCORRECT VALVE STEMS IN THE WHEELS AND SOME FAMILY IS IN A FATAL ACCIDENT BECAUSE NO ACTION IS TAKEN THEN WE ARE ALL REMISS IN OUR INACTION.*AK

EVERY DAY I AM FACED WITH A SERIOUS PROBLEM. THOUGH MY DISABILITY IS WHAT OTHERS MAY CONCIDER STRANGE, I AM A LARGE PERSON.  I USED TO OWN A CADILLAC AND HAD NO TROUBLE ACQUIRING A 4" SEAT BELT EXTENTION PIECE TO ATTACH TO MY SEAT BELT SO THAT I TO CAN DRIVE SAFELY AND COMFORTABLY. HOWEVER, I HAVE NOW PURCHASED A DAEWOO LEGANZA AND HAVE THE NEED JUST THE SAME TO HAVE A SEAT BELT EXTENTION PIECE.  I HAVE CONTACTED THE DEALER MANY TIMES, I HAVE WRITTEN TO THE CORPORATE CUSTOMER SERVICE DEPT. AND TO MY SURPRISE THEY ARE ALL UNABLE TO HELP ME.  THEREFORE, EACH DAY I GET IN MY CAR, I AM FACED WITH A SERIOUS PROBLEM. DO I TRY TO BUCKLE UP OR NOT. THERE ARE MANY DAYS I JUST CAN NOT BUCKLE UP.  I DO NOT UNDERSTAND WHY OR HOW THIS PROBLEM IS OCCURING THAT I AM NOT ABLE TO GET AN EXTENTION FROM DAEWOO, YET WHEN I HAD THE CADI, I COULD. STRANGE, DAEWOOS ANSWER TO ME WAS THAT THE SEAT BELT EXTENTION HAD NOT YET BEEN APPROVED BY THE SAFETY COMMISSION AND THAT THEY HAD NO SUCH ITEM AVAILABLE.  I AM NOT ASKING FOR THE ITEM, I AM A CONSUMER WITH A DISABILITY THAT OTHERS MAY FEEL IS UNIMPORTANT, HOWEVER I TOO WOULD LIKE TO BE SAFE WHILE DRIVING. PLEASE HELP ME TO FIND OUT HOW TO OBTAIN  TWO (2) SEAT BELT EXTENTIONS FOR MY 1999 DAEWOO LEGANZA AND HELP ME TO DRIVE WITH COMFORT AND A SAFE PIECE OF MIND.  THANK YOU FOR ANY HELP THAT YOU CAN SUPPLY ME WITH. I HAVE OFFERED TO PAY FOR THE BELTS AS WELL AS THE SHIPPING, PLEASE EXTEND THAT SAME OFFER TO ANYONE THAT MAY BE ABLE TO HELP ME. AGAIN THANK YOU FOR LISTENING TO MY VERY SCARY PROBLEM.*AK

IN DEC. OF 2000 I LEFT GULF STREAM  WITH BEAUDRY RV OF TUCSON,AZ FOR ROUTINE MAINTENANCE WHILE AWAY FOR THE HOLIDAYS. UPON MY RETURN I WAS ADVISE BY A TECH. THERE (LARRY EVERHEART) THAT THE RIDE HEIGHT OF THE COACH WAS INCORRECT AND A POTENTIAL SAFTEY FACTOR. HE WAS AMAZED THAT AFTER ALMOST 2 YEARS I HAD NOT HIT SOMETHING OR HAD AN ACCIDENT. HE HAD CONFIRMED THE PROPER SETTINGS WITH A RICK VEGA OF SPARTAN MOTORS IN CHARLOTTE MI. THE BUILDER OF THE CHASSIS. THE CORRECT SETTINGS ARE AS FOLLOWS: 9 1/2 INCHES FRONT AND 6 1/2 INCHES REAR. MY COACH WAS 6 INCHES FRONT AND 4 1/4 INCHES REAR. HE WAS FURTHER ADVISED THESE SETTINGS ARE TO BE SET PROPERLY ONCE THE BODY IS PUT ON THE CHASSIS. WHEN MR. TONY HERMAN OF GULF STREAM WAS ADVISED OF THE CONDITION, HE TRIED TO PASS IT BACK TO SPARTAN AND STATED THAT THE SETTINGS CAN CHANGE. BOTH TECHS AT SPARTAN AND BEAUDRY DENIED THIS STATEING THAT SETTINGS NEVER CHANGE ONCE PROPERLY SET. EVEN THOUGH THE VEHILCE IS OUT OF WARRANTY, THIS IS A SAFTEY ISSUE AND GULF STREAM SHOULD PAY FOR THE PROPER ADJUSTMENT. THEY REFUSED TO PAY OR EVEN OFFER TO SHARE THE COST OF $!00. THIS IS THERE TYPICAL ATTTIUDE REGARDS TO ANY REPAIRS OR ADJUSTMENTS EVEN WHEN WARRANTY WAS IN EFFECT. IT IS MY UNDERSTANDING FROM SPEAKING TO MANY OTHER RV'ERS AN INDUSTRY WIDE ATTITUDE. THE DEALER FROM WHOM I PURCHASED THE COACH (LONG VIEW RV OF WINDSOR LOCKS CT, 860-623-3326 FRANK ROBERTS) HAS BEEN HELPFUL GETTING THINGS DONE IN THIS REGARD AND EVEN THEY GET A HARD TIME FROM GULF STREAM. WHEN ONE IS IGNORED OR BRUSHED OFF ON SAFTEY ISSUES SUCH AS THIS, ITS TIME FOR THE PROPER AUTHORITY TO GIVE A LOOK AT THE ENTIRE INDUSTRY. THANKYOU FOR YOUR ASSISTENCE AND CONCERN IN THIS MATTER.
TREAD SEPARATED FROM TIRE.  *AK (TIRESIZE: 245 75R16)( DOT NUMBER:  TIRE SIZE: 245 75R16 )

THERE ARE SEVERAL MAKES OF CARS AND VANS, ESPECIALLY EXPENSIVE MODELS, THAT RELEASE THE EMERGENCY BRAKE THE MINUTE YOU PUT THE AUTOMATIC TRANSMISSION IN GEAR.   ON TOP OF THAT, MOST OF THEM LOCK ALL DOORS WHEN THE SHIFT LEVER IS PLACED IN DRIVE AND SOME OTHER GEARS.  THEY ALSO UNLOCK THE ALL VEHICLE DOORS WHEN SHIFTED INTO NEUTRAL OR PARK.  I DON'T UNDERSTAND HOW NHTSA HAS PERMITTED MANUFACTURERS TO INSTALL SUCH UNSAFE SYSTEMS IN CARS/VANS.  FOR ONE, THERE ARE PEOPLE THAT HAVE LEFT CARS IN GEAR WITH EMERGENCY ON, AND WHEN THEY CLOSE THE DOOR THEY LOCK INSTANTANEOUSLY, LEAVING THE DRIVER LOCKED OUT.  ALSO, IF A 5 OR 6 YEAR CHILD IS LEFT UNATTENDED INSIDE A CAR AND HE SHIFTS THE TRANSMISSION INTO GEAR AND THE EMERGENCY BRAKE AUTOMATICALLY COMES OFF,  DO I HAVE TO TELL YOU WHAT COULD HAPPEN?  ALSO IF A TECHNICIAN OR BACKYARD MECHANIC IS FIXING A CAR AND HE FORGETS THAT THE EMERGENCY COMES OFF AUTOMATICALLY AND ASKS SOMEONE TO PUT THE CAR IN GEAR,  DO I HAVE TO TELL YOU WHAT COULD HAPPEN?  ALSO, THERE ARE PEOPLE THAT PLACE THE SHIFT LEVER IN NEUTRAL EVERYTIME THEY COME TO A RED LIGHT.  ALL DOORS WILL UNLOCK, AND HE COULD BECOME A VICTIM OF A HYJACK!  SOMETIMES I WONDER WHAT KIND OF VISION SOME ENGINEERS HAVE, ESPECIALLY SAFETY ENGINEERS!  ALL THESE ADVANCES DO IS MAKE PEOPLE LAZY AND ARTHRITIC.  SOME OF THESE ADVANCES ALSO MAKE CARS UNSAFE BECAUSE THEY ARE NOT ACCOMPANIED WITH REQUIRED TECHNICIAN UPDATED/CONTINUING EDUCATION AND SOME ELIMINATE THEM TO RESOLVE PROBLEMS.  *AK

REMOVE DAYTIME RUNNING LIGHTS. THEY ARE BLINDING WHEN COMING AT YOU AND FORCE YOU TO USE THE NIGHT TIME SETTING OF YOUR REAR VIEW MIRROR WHEN BEHIND YOU. THIS DECREASES YOUR ABILITY TO SEE BEHIND YOU BOTH BECAUSE OF THE INTENSE LIGHT AND THE DARKER MIRROR. THE THOUGHT WAS GOOD, BUT THE EXECUTION IS NOT. I FEAR IT CAUSES MORE ACCIDENTS THAN IT PREVENTS. THIS IS ALSO TRUE WITH MOTORCYCLES WHOSE HEADLAMP IS AT TOO HIGH AN ANGLE AND IS WORSE THAN CAR DAYTIME LIGHTS.  *AK

MY COMPLAINT HAS TO DO WITH DAYTIME DRIVING LIGHTS.  DRIVING LIGHTS HAVE BEEN ONE OF THE BEST SAFETY ADDITIONS TO AUTOMOBILES IN YEARS.  HOWEVER, ALMOST EVERY MANUFACTURER HAS FORGOTTEN ONE ADDITIONAL SAFETY FACTOR.  WHEN DRIVING LIGHTS ARE ON, THE TAIL LIGHTS ARE NOT ON.  THIS IS NOT A PROBLEM ON FAIR DAYS BUT DOES PRESENT A PROBLEM ON RAINY OR FOGGY DAYS.  I HAVE NOTICED RECENTLY WHEN APPROACHING A VEHICLE FROM THE REAR ON A RAINY OR FOGGY DAY WITH POOR VISIBILITY, THE TAIL LIGHTS ARE NOT ON, BUT WHEN PASSING THE VEHICLE, THE DRIVING LIGHTS ARE ON.  I FEEL THIS IS A DEFINITE SAFETY ISSUE.  EVEN THOUGH YOU CAN SEE A CAR APPROACHING YOU ON A DAY WITH POOR VISIBILITY, YOU CAN NOT ALWAYS SEE A CAR IN TIME FROM THE REAR ON A DAY WITH POOR VISIBILITY.  I BELIEVE IT WOULD BE A PRUDENT ACTION BY THE NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION, TO HAVE CAR MANUFACTURERS BEGIN INTERCONNECTING THE DAYTIME DRIVING LIGHTS WITH THE TAIL LIGHTS.  IT MAY EVEN BE ADVISABLE TO HAVE ALL CARS MANUFACTURED PREVIOUSLY WITH DAYTIME DRIVING LIGHTS THAT DO NOT HAVE TAIL LIGHTS THAT BURN WITH THE DRIVING LIGHTS TO BE RECALLED AND HAVE THIS INTERCONNECTION MADE.  THANK YOU FOR THIS OPPORTUNITY TO SHARE MY CONCERN.*AK

THIS TRAILER HAULS AROUND 15 TONS AND THEY HAVE USED VERY WEAK MATERIAL TO MOUNT THE TURNTABLE TO THE DOLLY THAT SUPPORTS THE AXLE UNDER THE TRAILER. THESE MOUNTS HAVE ALL BROKEN AND THE TRAILER IS COMPLETELY UNSAFE TO DRIVE. HAD THIS CUSTOMER NOT NOTICED THAT THESE WERE BROKE, THIS TRAILER COULD HAVE COME APART INTO TWO PIECES AND KILLED SOMEBODY. 15 TONS OF STEEL AND MATERIAL IS NOT SOMETHIMG THAT I WOULD TO FLYING DOWN THE FREEWAY  OUT OF CONTROL.  *AK

THESE ELECTRICAL PROBLEMS STARTED W/ THE AUTOMATIC SLIDING DOOR.  IT MALFUNCTIONED & CAUSED THE KEYLESS REMOTE CONTROL NOT TO WORK, NO RADIO, A/C GOT STUCK IN THE ON POSITION, & NO OVERHEAD LCD READOUTS (TEMP, AVG. MPG, ETC).  THE DEALER TOLD ME THIS WAS JUST A BLOWN FUSE.  THEY REPACED IT & IT WORKED FINE FOR ABOUT 3 MONTHS.  THEN, WHILE I WAS ON VACATION, IT HAPPENED AGAIN.  ONLY WE WERE IN THE SNOW (WITH THE A/C STUCK ON).  AGAIN ALL OF THE SAME ORIGINAL PROBLEMS, BUT THIS TIME THE CAR WOULD JUST SHUT OFF.  I WOULD WAIT A FEW MINUTES & RESTART IT.  IT WOULD START RIGHT UP.  BUT IT KEPT DIEING - FOR 150 MILES -  UNTIL I REACHED THE DEALERSHIP!  LONG STORY SHORT - THEY REPLACED A 'COMPUTER' & SOME WIRING -- TWICE, BUT ALWAYS THE SAME PROBLEMS.  THEY TOLD ME THE AUTOMATIC DOOR HAD CAUSED AN ELECTRICAL FIRE, AND THE COMPUTER SHUT DOWN THE CAR AS A PROTECTION.  I JUST GAVE UP ON THE REPAIRS & CAME HOME.  I LOST 4+ DAYS OF A 10 DAY VACATION BECAUSE OF THE CAR PROBLEMS.  THE DEALERSHIP HERE REPACED IT AGAIN (FOR THE 4TH TIME).  THEN IT STARTED ACTING UP AGAIN.  I TALKED TO THE DEALER.  THIS CAR IS AN OBVIOUS LEMON & QUALIFIES FOR THE CALIFORNIA LEMON LAW.  THEY TOLD ME I HAD TO CONTACT GM/PONTIAC.  THEY (GM) BASICALLY TOLD ME - THEY DO NOT TAKE CARS BACK -- THEY DO NOT ABIDE BY THE CALIFORNIA LEMON LAW AND IF I WANTED (OR HAD THE THE $), I COULD TAKE THEM TO COURT.  THEN, I RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE ON THE AUTOMATIC DOOR.  (STRANGE THING IS - I DONT SEE THE RECALL NOTICE LISTED HERE!)  THEY REPLACED THE PARTS AGAIN (5TH TIME!).  RECENTLY (SEPT 99) I TOOK A TRIP ON A LONG WEEKEND.  AGAIN THE CAR DIED ON ME (SAME SET OF PROBLEMS).  THIS TIME THEY SAID IT WAS AN OXYGEN SENSOR (ONLY THEY DIDNT KNOW THE PREVIOUS DEALER HAD ALREADY REPLACED IT!), AND THE OTHER PROBLEMS -- THEY COULDN'T DUPLICATE.  THERE HAVE BEEN MANY MORE ONE TIME PROBLEMS, BUT I THINK I COVERED THE MAJOR PROBLEMS - IS THERE ANY HELP TO FIGHT GM?

THE ELECTRIC DOORS THAT OPEN AND CLOSE (OR AT LEAST THEY ARE SUPPOSE TO...) WITH THE PUSH OF A BUTTON HAVE FAILED ON BOTH SIDES OF THE VEHICLE.  WE WERE NOT MADE AWARE OF THIS PROBLEM AT THE TIME OF THE PURCHASE BUT LATER FOUND OUT THAT IT WAS A MAJOR PROBLEM WITH THIS VAN.

GEARBOX-BUMPED POST BENT GEARSHAFT AND HAD BILL HEARD TO REPLACE IT,BUT WARRENTY WOULDN'T COVER IT.PAID OUT OF POCKET $875.10.#2 AIRBAG DIDN'T DEPLOYE EITHER TIME WHEN I BUMP POST AND WHEN I TOTALED TRUCK.FIRST TIME NEITHER SIDE DEPLOYED AND THE DRIVERSIDE DIDN'T DEPLOYE WHEN I TOTALED TRUCK.#3 ANTI-LOCK BRAKES-THE ANTI-LOCK BRAKES DIDN'T WORK PROPERLY THE DAY I TOTALED TRUCK.ONLY MARKS ON PAVEMENT WAS YAW MARKS.WHICH RESULTED IN A BROKEN NECK,RUPERED SPLEEN,BROKEN RIBS,BROKEN LEFT ARM WITH NERVE DAMAGE,CONCESSION

WHILE INSPECTING THE REAR BRAKE PADS ON MY 1999 SUZUKI LC 1500 MOTORCYCLE, I FOUND THE INSIDE PAD WORN ALMOST TO THE BACKING PLATE.  THIS IS SIGNIFICANT IN THAT IT WAS FOUND BY CHANCE, WELL BEFORE THE 4000 MILE SCHEDULED INSPECTION PERIOD.  I PREVIOUSLY SUBMITTED THIS PROBLEM (ODI NUMBER 709423) BUT FAILED TO FIND IT IN THE DATABASE.  JUDGING BY THE NUMEROUS OTHER COMPLAINTS I HAVE READ (SEE HTTP://WWW.INTRUDERALERT.COM AND WWW.UNDERWRITE.COM), THIS APPEARS TO BE A GENERIC PROBLEM WITH THIS MODEL.  1000 MILES AFTER REPLACING THE PADS, I HAVE NOTED THAT THE INSIDE PAD IS AGAIN WEARING OUT FIRST.

FIRST FAILURE HAPPEND WHILE I WAS PASSING SOME CARS ON A BROKEN YELLOW LINE(2) LANE.MIDWAY BETWEEN THE VEHICLES THE BIKE SHUT DOWN FOR ABOUT 5SECONDS THEN TURNED BACK ON .LUCKILY THERE WAS NO CARS COMING THE OTHER WAY .SECOND TIME I WAS ON AN A SINGLE LANE ONRAMP DOING ABOUT 65MPH THE BIKE SHUTDOWN FOR ABOUT 8 SECONDS AND THEN RESTARTED .THERE WAS AN 18 WHEELER THAT WAS TAILGATING ME AND I CAME VERY CLOSE TO BEING RUN OVER! THE BIKE ALSO IDLE`S IRRATICALLY AND SOMETIMES BACKFIRES  WHEN I DOWN SHIFT.I AM A MEMBER OF THE HAYABUSA`S OWNERS GROUP AND THIS SEEMS TO BE A COMMON PROBLEM.SUZUKI DOESN`T SEEM TO BE IN ANY HURRY TO FIX THIS POSIBLE LIFE THREATNING PROBLEM.

I PLACED THE MOTORCYCLE ON ITS SIDESTAND IN MY DRIVEWAY ON FAIRLY LEVEL GROUND. AS I WALKED AWAY THE MOTORCYCLE TIPPED OVER TO THE LEFT AND KNOCKED ME TO THE GROUND. I SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES AND THERE WAS MINOR DAMAGE TO THE MOTORCYCLE. PRIOR TO AND AFTER THE INCIDENT THE SIDESTAND WORKED PROPERLY. BUT, I BELIEVE THAT THE DESIGN IS FLAWED IN SUCH A WAY THE MINOR UNDULATIONS IN THE SURFACE UNDER THE MOTORCYCLE, OR MINOR MOVEMENTS OF THE MOTORCYCLE WHILE IT IS ON ITS SIDESTAND, CAUSE THE SIDESTAND TO RETRACT ENOUGH FOR THE MOTORCYCLE TO FALL OVER. I PARTICIPATE IN AN INTERNET FORUM OF GSX1300R OWNERS. TO DATE NINE INCIDENTS VERY SIMILAR TO MINE HAVE BEEN REPORTED BY FORUM PARTICIPANTS. I AM AN EXPERIENCED MOTOCYCLIST AND HAVE HAD MANY DIFFERENT TYPE OF MOTORCYCLES. THIS IS THE FIRST TIME SUCH A THING HAS HAPPENED TO ME.

SUMMARY OF 2 PROBLEMS WE ARE EXPERIENCING:  1) POWER ASSIST STEERING BINDING (STICKING) DURING LEFT TURN AND ACCELERATION; THE STEERING WHEEL WILL STICK AT ABOUT THE 10 O'CLOCK POSITION AND REQUIRE UNUSUAL MANUAL OVERRIDE TO RETURN TO STRAIGHT AHEAD POSITION.  WE CONSIDER THIS CONDITION ANNOYING AT BEST AND A SAFETY HAZZARD.  2) TIRES PROBLEM: VEHICLE PULLS TO THE LEFT SINCE NEW AND REQUIRES CONSTANT STEERING INPUT TO KEEP POINTED STRAIGHT AHEAD.  AFTER TWO ATTEMPTS BY DEALER TO FIX PROBLEM (DEALER SIMPLY ROTATED TIRES FRONT TO REAR AND LEFT TO RIGHT) VEHICLE STILL PULLS SLIGHTLY TO LEFT, BUT NOW MORE SO UNDER BRAKING.  TOYOTA MANUFACTURER REPRESENTATIVE IS NOW INVOLVED, HAS NOTED EXISTENCE OF BOTH PROBLEMS AND HAS ORDERED REPLACEMENT PARTS FOR POWER STEERING PROBLEM; THEY ARE UNSURE AS YET WHAT IS CAUSING TIRE PULLING BEHAVIOR.( DOT NUMBER:   TIRE SIZE: 215/60R15 )

WE ARE A MOVING COMPANY AND WE WERE USING THIS TRAILER FOR MOVING SOMEONE'S HOUSEHOLD GOODS.  DURING THE MOVE, A FIRE OCCURRED IN THE BACK OF THE TRAILER THAT WE FEEL MAY BE DUE TO FAULTY WIRING.  WE ARE NOT SURE ABOUT THIS BUT SOME OF THE FIREMEN SPECULATED THAT THE FIRE PROBABLY STARTED FROM THE WIRING.  I AM CURIOUS IF THERE HAVE BEEN OTHER COMPLAINTS REGARDING THESE TRAILERS OR IF THERE IS A WAY FOR ME TO DETERMINE EXACTLY WHAT CAUSED THIS FIRE.  THE WOMAN WHO WE WERE MOVING LOST EVERYTHING, INCLUDING A STEINWAY GRAND PIANO SO THIS HAS BEEN QUITE A LOSS.  IF YOU HAVE ANY INFORMATION FOR ME, I WOULD CERTAINLY APPRECIATE IT.
CAR IS 5 MO.OLD THIS IS FIRST MAJOR PROBLEM

AFTER MAKING A LEFT TURN THE STEERING BINDS AT ~20 - 40 DEGREES LEFT OF STEERING WHEEL CENTER. THE OPERATOR HAS TO BE AWARE OF THIS AND TURN THE STEERING WHEEL PAST THIS BINDING POINT TO RETURN TO CENTER. THE BINDING FEELS MORE INTENSE WHEN THE THROTTLE IS APPLIED ACCELERATING IN A LEFT TURN FROM A STOP OR GOING UP A HILL WITH THROTTLE APPLIED AND TURNING SLIGHTLY TO THE LEFT PAST THIS BIND POINT. THE STEERING WHEEL STILL DOES NOT RETURN PAST THE BIND POINT EVEN IF THE OPERATOR LETS UP OFF THE THROTTLE COMPLETELY.THIS PROBLEM DOES NOT OCCUR AT ALL DURING RIGHT TURNS. I CONTACTED THE DEALER AND MANUFACTURER WHO BOTH DENY ANY KNOWLEDGE OF THIS PROBLEM EVEN THOUGH I HAVE SEEN REPORTS OF THIS ON THE NHTSA WEB SITE AND OTHER INTERNET MESSAGE BOARDS FROM OWNERS AROUND THE COUNTRY. IT SEEMS TOYOTA SHOULD KNOW ABOUT THIS ISSUE BY NOW UNLESS THEY ARE TRYING TO COVER THIS UP FOR SOME REASON.

THE SHOCKS IN THE REAR OF THE BIKE DO NOT TAKE UP THE MOVMENT OF THE SWINGARM.THE BELT GUARD STRIKES THE REAR FENDER AT EVERY DIP INTHE ROADEVEN THOUGH THE SHOCKS ARE ADJUSTED TO THE MAX.AT SPEEDS ABOVE 50MPH IT CAUSES THE MOTORCYCLE TO BE PUSHED TO THE RIGHT HAND SIDE OF THE ROAD AND THE FRONT WHEEL TO WOBBLE. THE PROBLEM IS MAGNIFIED WHEN YOU HAVE A PASSENGER. THE FREDERICK MD. DEALER IN WHICH I LIVE CLOSER TO OFFERD TO SELL ME BEEFED UP SHOCKS TO FIX THE PROBLEM, BUT I DON'T THINK I SHOULD HAVE TO PAY SEVERAL HUNDRED DOLLARS TO FIX A DEFECT.
NOTHING TO PREVENT THESE TYPE OF SEATS FROM PITCHING THE CHILD TOWARD THE REAR SEAT IN A REAR-END COLLISION.  HOW CAN THESE SEATS POSSIBLY BE ON THE MARKET?
THE VOLVO S80 LIGHT TAUPE COLOR DASHBOARD REFLECTS ONTO WINDSHIELD, MAKING IS VERY HARD TO SEE OUT OF THE WINDSHIELD DURING DAYTIME DRIVING. THIS IS TRULY A HAZARDOUS SITUATION.

ANOTHER CHILD HAS DIED AS A RESULT OF HEAT EXPOSURE IN A CLOSED, LOCKED CAR - BAKING IN THE SUN.  THIS SITUATION COULD HAVE BEEN PREVENTED IF THE PARENT HADN'T PUT THE CHILD INTO THIS SITUATION.  IT COULD ALSO HAVE BEEN PREVENTED IF THE CAR'S TEMPERATURE SENSOR, COUPLED WITH A MICROPHONE, WERE CONNECTED TO A LOGIC UNIT THAT COULD DETECT THE COMBINATION OF INTENSE HEAT, CLOSED DOORS, AND A CHILD'S SCREAMS.  THE CAR'S HORN COULD THEN HAVE BEEN SOUNDED, EFFECTIVELY CARRYING THE ALARM OF THE CHILD'S UNHEARD VOICE TO THE OUTSIDE WORLD - A CRY FOR HELP.  THE LOGIC COULD BE CODED IN THE FOLLOWING WAY:  IF [(DANGEROUS TEMPERATURE LEVEL) AND (CAR NOT RUNNING) AND ((CHILD SCREAMING) OR (DOOR HANDLE PULLED FROM INSIDE))] THENCAUSE CAR HORN TO SOUND;  END IF;  THE ONLY THING A CAR MANUFACTURER WOULD HAVE TO ADD TO THE CURRENT CONFIGURATION IS A MICROPHONE AND THIS SHORT LOGIC STATEMENT IN THE CAR'S ELECTRONICS.

A SEAT ASSEMBLY OF APPROXIMATTELY 75 POUNDS IS LOCATED IN THE PASSENGER AREA.  IN THE EVENT OF A SUDDEN MANEUVER OR ROLLOVER, THIS SEAT IS FREEE TO MOVE ABOUT AND INJURE PASSENGERS SITTING IN OTHER CLOSELY LOCATED SEATING POSITONS.  MOVEMENT OF THIS SEAT CAN ALSO HIT OR DISTRACT THE DRIVER DURING EMERGENCY SITUATIONS.  I HAVE LEARNED THAT THIS SEAT IS NOW A COMMON FEATURE OF CLASS A RV'S FROM THIS MANUFACTURER.  *AK

THERE IS SOME PROBLEM WITH THE WINDSHIELD WIPERS ON THE COUNTRY COACH ALLURE, AND MAYBE SEVERAL OTHER LINES FROM COUNTRY COACH.  WHILE OUR COACH WAS AT BUDDY GREGG'S FOR REPAIRS, A NEW WINDSHIELD WIPER LINKAGE MODIFICATION KIT WAS INSTALLED.  WHEN WE GOT THE COACH BACK THE WINDSHIELD WIPERS CLEAR LITTLE MORE THAN HALF OF THE WINDSHIELD.  WHEN I AM IN A NORMAL DRIVING POSITION, THE WINDSHIELD WIPER WILL CLEAR FROM NEAR THE CENTER OF THE WINDSHIELD TO ABOUT MY LEFT EAR.  IT WILL CLEAR THE WINDSHIELD SO THAT I CAN SEE THE LANE THAT I AM DRIVING IN, BUT LITTLE OR NOTHING TO MY LEFT.  BESIDES BEING VERY DISTRACTING, I DON'T BELIEVE THIS WILL MEET THE MINIMUM STANDARDS OF THE US DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION, NATIONAL HIGHWAY TRAFFIC SAFETY ADMINISTRATION.  I AM PRESENTLY IN THE PROCESS OF CHECKING ON COMPLIANCE OF NATIONAL STANDARDS.
THE PHYSICS OF THE HOT NEW SUVS MAKE THEM DEADLY TO SMALLER VEHCILES, AND EACHOTHER. I SERIOUSLY SUGGEST A HEAVY TAX ON THESE VEHICLES. I DRIVE A NORMAL CAR, AND WANT TO LIVE. THANK YOU.

THE STUPID BLINKING LIGHTS ARE DISTRACTING IN TRAFFIC AND WILL CAUSE MORE ACCIDENTS THAN THEY PREVENT.  THEY WILL BE A MAJOR CAUSE OF ROAD RAGE WHEN THEY BECOME COMMON.  WHOEVER HAD THE IDEA SHOULD HAVE TO SIT BEHIND A CAR IN TRAFFIC WITH THE BLINKING BRAKE LIGHT FLASHING IN THEIR FACE FOR AN HOUR IN THE MORNING AND AN HOUR IN THE EVENING.
SUV'S ARE TOO HIGH. THEIR LIGHTS BLIND ME DRIVING AT NIGHT AND DURING THE DAY I CANNOT SEE PAST THEM TO ANTICIPATE WHAT THE TRAFFIC IS DOING. A STUDY NEEDS TO BE DONE ON THIS.
ALL NEW VEHICLE WITH AIRBAGS HAVE INSUFFICIENT DISTANCE BETWEEN THE SEAT AND THE ROOF.CONSUMER IS 6'5" TALL AND HIT HIS HEAD ON EVERYTHING.UNKNOWN MAKE/MODEL. ADDED ON 09-07-1999. *AK
